commentary_data: Squad: Yashasvi Jaiswal, Jos Buttler, Sanju Samson(w/c), Devdutt Padikkal, Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Ravichandran Ashwin, Trent Boult, Obed McCoy, Yuzvendra Chahal, Sandeep Sharma, Kunal Singh Rathore, Abdul Basith, Donavon Ferreira, Dhruv Jurel, Kuldeep Sen, Kuldip Yadav, KM Asif, KC Cariappa, Akash Vasisht, Navdeep Saini, Murugan Ashwin, Adam Zampa, Jason Holder, Joe Root

Day three of the IPL and two other teams get to play their opening game of the season. Two teams that many experts are already calling the favorites to make the playoffs. Certainly two of the most balanced sides this season in terms of combinations and options. Yes, I’m talking about Sunrisers Hyderabad and Rajasthan Royals.

First to the hosts, who have a new old captain leading today with the South African trio of Markram, Jansen and Klaasen missing. Their absence actually means it easy to slot in their overseas picks, as SRH need to pick four out of their five available foreigners, with Farooqi most likely to miss out. This could include an SRH debut for Adil Rashid and Glenn Phillips, and an IPL debut for England's wow talent Harry Brook. Add to that a top-order of Mayank Agarwal, an in-form Abhishek Sharma and Rahul Tripathi coupled with a solid core of Indian pacers, SRH really look a scary prospect this year in the IPL.

And now to the visitors and runners-up Rajasthan Royals. They've retained the bulk of that roster, roped in Jason Holder who will be that bridge player between the bowlers and batters. Holder's inclusion makes the Rajasthan team balance a lot more solid, as they already have two reliable spinners in Ashwin and Chahal, and have Trent Boult for the powerplays. Up top, Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal are both in good nick, and skipper Sanju Samson will be eyeing this season as a potential gateway back into the Indian team. Two power-packed squads, plus plenty of options as substitutes - we should have a cracker of a game! Stay tuned for toss and team updates...

Once again a fantastic venue, the pitch is more or less central- pretty even boundaries all along. The pitch looks pristine, a bit like how an English pitch would be, covered by dried grass and white in color. There won't be ready-made turn for for the spinners. Hyderabad has been a high-scoring venue, teams that have won chasing have an average score of 190. So that tells you this is a venue where you are better off chasing, because sometimes in the pressure to get runs on the board you end up with just 150-160. The pitch is perfect, one where you would want to chase. In the afternoon, maybe there might be some turn, quips
News coming in - Holder and KM Asif handed RR caps. SRH will have Mayank, Brook and a few other debutants.

We will bowl first, looks like a good batting wicket. Will take advantage with the chase. (On captaincy) Just the one game this time. I'll try my best and do what is needed for the team. Farooqi, Harry Brook, Adil Rashid, Glenn Phillips are our four foreigners.

This is a new IPL with new rules. We have to respect the opponents and play to our strengths. Always feel good to wear this jersey, looking forward to playing in Jaipur. (On Sangakkara) We have a good relationship with each other. Discuss things regularly before games. Four foreigners today for us - Buttler, Holder, Boult and Hetmyer.

We are very excited, it’s the first match. Definitely, when you do well, it helps the team. I have had a very good partnership with Ashwin last year and we would like to continue that. We need to win games consistently and we need to work hard in every game as our goal is to not only reach the playoffs but reach the top two. We would have to travel a lot, as there will be home and away games and there will be back-to-back games. It’s a new journey for us, so the focus is on present. It is a challenging thing but there are breaks as well in the schedule so it’s fine.
(Playing XI): Mayank Agarwal, Abhishek Sharma, Rahul Tripathi, Harry Brook, Glenn Phillips(w), Washington Sundar, Adil Rashid, Bhuvneshwar Kumar(c), Umran Malik, T Natarajan, Fazalhaq Farooqi
(Playing XI): Yashasvi Jaiswal, Jos Buttler, Sanju Samson(w/c), Devdutt Padikkal, Shimron Hetmyer, Riyan Parag, Jason Holder, Ravichandran Ashwin, Trent Boult, KM Asif, Yuzvendra Chahal

I am looking forward to the IPL, hopefully we are going to have a packed crowd here. The stadium looks awesome, they were painting it the other day, all orange so it’s good to be out here. Haven’t played much T20 cricket since the World Cup so hopefully I can go out there and hit a few off the middle, get to a decent score and contribute to the team. (On Adil Rashid) He is world-class and he is one of the best bowlers in the world for a reason. He is a wicket-taker, just like most legspinners but he is a very clever bowler and watches the batters hard and tries to adapt to what the batters are doing. So, he is going to be an extremely good addition to the team. (On missing a few key players initially) We are missing the captain so it is a big miss, but they have got other commitments. I am sure they will slide in perfectly into the side in a couple of games. We have to focus on this game for now and we are looking forward to it.

We had a really good last year but it is very much about starting fresh. It is about playing what is in front of us and focusing on the here and now. (On Holder) He brings some good balance with the bat and the ball, it is fantastic to have in T20 cricket. The Impact Player rule adds another dynamic. (On Prasidh Krishna’s injury) Disappointing for him to be injured but it gives someone else an opportunity to step up. (On the importance of playing spin well) It is very important. It has been a prevalent part in T20 cricket wherever you play so it is exciting to play in different venues - that is part of what makes the IPL special.
Abdul Samad, Mayank Dagar, Upendra Yadav, Mayank Markande, Vivrant Sharma.
Sandeep Sharma, Donavon Ferreira, Dhruv Jurel, Navdeep Saini, Murugan Ashwin.
A moment's silence to mourn the loss of the legendary - India's first Arjuna awardee.

Out walks the umpires, followed by the players. A sea of Orange at the Rajiv Gandhi Stadium - barely any empty seats for this afternoon game despite it being 35 degrees! Jaiswal to take strike, Bhuvi Kumar to bowl to him. Can he get some swing? Let's find out...

Bhuvneshwar to Jaiswal, no run, length ball that angles inwards after pitching on middle. Jaiswal charges out first ball and the ball deflects off his pads towards the keeper. Nice low take by the stand-in keeper, a half-hearted appeal but no bat
Bhuvneshwar to Jaiswal, , this one stays straight and ends down the leg side on a length

Bhuvneshwar to Jaiswal, , Bhuvneshwar goes a tad fuller onto off, Jaiswal with a gentle push down the ground that beats Brook's dive at mid-off. The outfield does the rest to allow for the first boundary
Bhuvneshwar to Jaiswal, 1 run, length ball on the pads, turned between mid-wicket and mid-on
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, no run, full and a bit of wobble around off. Buttler with a defensive push towards mid-off
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, no run, length ball just outside off, Buttler defends into the pitch
Two slips in place now
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, no run, full onto middle and leg, bit of late away movement. Pushed towards mid-on. Buttler still to get off the mark
Two slips for Farooqi as well
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, , too full on the boots and what an elegant flick between mid-wicket and mid-on from Jaiswal. Signs of a man in form says Harsha Bhogle on air!!
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, no run, full and just outside off, pushed to mid-off
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, 3 runs, full with some width, Jaiswal chips his drive over extra cover and the ball stops a bit on the outfield. The batters scamper back for three
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Buttler, 3 runs, full on the pads, turned past the mid-wicket fielder. Just a gentle push that almost runs away to the fence but Agarwal runs back in time to save a run
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, , short on off, pulled over mid-on and the 33-year-old Bhuvneshwar Kumar runs after it but the ball wins the race
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, no run, hard length on off, rushes onto Jaiswal who edges it onto his pads
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, no run, hard length on off, rushes onto Jaiswal who edges it onto his pads
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, , effortless!! Bhuvneshwar errs too full in the swinging arc of Buttler. Just a casual flick over mid-wicket from the English captain and that sails away for an 81-metre six!!
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, 2 runs, full on off, Buttler turns his drive to the left of mid-off and a fumble there allows the batters to come back for the second
Bhuvneshwar to Buttler, 1 run, fuller length on off, a slightly uppish punch to the left of mid-off. Half stopped by the fielder so just a single
Bhuvneshwar to Jaiswal, , slightly slower and on the pads, clipped past the close-in mid-wicket fielder and mid-on gives it a despairing dive but Jaiswal picks up another four!!

Bhuvneshwar to Jaiswal, , shoddy fielding!! This is short pitched on off, Jaiswal with a cute ramp over the keeper. Didn't come off the middle and Malik at short third had two efforts to pull the ball back but fails both times...
Bhuvneshwar to Jaiswal, no run, good length outside off, a swing and a miss.
Washington Sundar to Buttler, , too short on middle stump, allows Buttler to rock back and pull powerfully over deep square leg to welcome Washington Sundar with a six!!
Washington Sundar to Buttler, , short again, off the backfoot again, heaved again. This one goes even longer and higher, over long-on this time for six more...
Washington Sundar to Buttler, no run, flat delivery with a bit of turn onto off, punched off the backfoot but stopped by the man at covers

Washington Sundar to Buttler, 1 run, Washington goes fuller, Buttler takes it on with a slog sweep. Doesn't time it cleanly and gets to deep mid-wicket on the bounce. The fielder might have had a chance had he gone for the dive
Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, , full and straying down leg, Jaiswal shuffles in and sweeps it behind square for a boundary!!
Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, 2 runs, full and quick onto off, punched through extra cover and Brook from mid-off chases after it and saves a couple of runs.
A false start for Natarajan. He has to reload.
T Natarajan to Buttler, , length delivery on off, Buttler gets forward and knifes that on the up, in the air but wide of mid-off, he is making a statement already
T Natarajan to Buttler, no run, good length and angling away from Buttler who again wants to go over mid-off, but fails to get bat on the shot, bit more oomph and pace on that delivery
T Natarajan to Buttler, , full and angling away from Buttler, in the slot and allows Buttler to free his arms, gets forward and opens the face of the bat on the loft, gets it over the off-side field
T Natarajan to Buttler, , full and angling away from Buttler, in the slot and allows Buttler to free his arms, gets forward and opens the face of the bat on the loft, gets it over the off-side field
T Natarajan to Buttler, , too much width outside off, shortish outside off, Buttler cuts and beats backward point on the dive to his right, relied on timing more than anything else

T Natarajan to Buttler, , this is carnage from Buttler. Length delivery wide outside off, Buttler gets forward and thrashes the drive, extra-cover dives to his left but no chance as it was hit so hard
T Natarajan to Buttler, 1 run, fullish on the stumps, Buttler gets forward to loft, gets an inside-edge onto the pad, the ball rolls away to the left of Buttler who sneaks a quick single
Really love seeing Jaiswal and buttler partnership even as a SRH fan.
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Buttler, , Buttler is toying with SRH. An off-pace short ball on the stumps, Buttler delays the pull and pulls it wide of deep square leg to his right
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Buttler, no run, good comeback. Another off-cutter slower ball just outside off, dips on Buttler who gets forward to drive and the dip beats him

Fazalhaq Farooqi to Buttler, ,  This was a catch to slip but such is the scoring rate that there's no chance of a slip, short of length outside off, Buttler slashes and the thick outside-edge flies wide of Glenn Phillips
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Buttler, , the attempted yorker on the stumps, is a low full-toss, Buttler gets forward to drive wide of mid-off, opened the face to get that in the gap
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Buttler,  Bowled!!

Fazalhaq Farooqi to Buttler,  Bowled!! Such a massive wicket that. SRH strike and get rid of the dangerous Buttler. A hard back of a length delivery on the stumps, nips back in ever so slightly, Buttler stays leg-side to punch, the pace beats him and clips the top of off-stump. The off-bail goes away and that's relief for SRH.
Are we watching highlights? This is a terrific start for Rajasthan Royals.
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Samson, no run, back of a length and on the hips, Samson gets right behind the line to defend
Exhilarating powerplay for RR. Buttler was next level as he toyed with the SRH attack. Jaiswal too complemented him and SRH will be relieved that Buttler is out.
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, 2 runs, flat legbreak on a good length on off, whipped wide of long-on for an easy couple
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, 2 runs, flat legbreak on a good length on off, whipped wide of long-on for an easy couple
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, no run, slides this on a length outside off, Jaiswal cuts to backward point and there is a fumble, but Samson sends Jaiswal back
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, no run, the googly but short, spins away from outside off, Jaiswal smashes the cut straight to the fielder at cover. Missed out there
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, 1 run, the front of the hand slider on the stumps, Jaiswal punches to long-on
Adil Rashid to Samson, 1 run, the googly and turns in to off and middle, Samson flicks in the air through the vacant mid-wicket area
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, , short but extra bounce outside off, Jaiswal delays the cut and leaves backward point and short third man ball-watching with a superb cut
Umran Malik to Samson, 1 run, back of a length and nips back in to the hips, Samson tucks it away to fine-leg
Umran Malik now round the wicket to Jaiswal. Jaiswal stops him as he is not happy with movement behind the bowler's arm.
Umran Malik to Jaiswal, 1 run, short of length drifting into the hips, nudged to fine-leg
Still no speedgun on Umran Malik so far.
Umran Malik to Samson, , good short ball at Samson, dug in and follows the batter who arches his back and uses the bat to ramp it over Glenn Phillips

Umran Malik to Samson, , it has flown away due to Umran Malik's extra pace, short of length delivery outside off, Samson opens the face of the bat and runs it down fine to third man, beats the fielder quickly
Umran Malik to Samson, 1 run, short of length outside off, dabbed to third man's right this time
Umran Malik to Jaiswal, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Jaiswal punches wide of backward point for one
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, no run, slower and fraction short on off, Jaiswal makes room to cut to backward point
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, 1 run, slower legbreak on the pads, flicked to deep square leg who gets there quickly, Jaiswal is sent back
Adil Rashid to Samson, no run, lovely legbreak that has turned and beaten Samson. Rips away to beat the tentative poke
Adil Rashid to Samson, 2 runs, slower legbreak outside off, Samson cuts wide of Tripathi at sweeper cover, they take a quick two
Adil Rashid to Samson, 1 run, quicker and on a good length on the stumps, Samson goes on the back foot to nudge to the vacant square leg area
Adil Rashid to Samson, 1 run, quicker and on a good length on the stumps, Samson goes on the back foot to nudge to the vacant square leg area
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, 1 run, . Went really low and Phillips had no chance of catching that
Umran Malik to Jaiswal, , wow! A half-volley outside off, Jaiswal gets forward and crashes that with brutal power through cover-point, no chance for sweeper cover
Umran Malik to Jaiswal, no run, full outside off, cramps Jaiswal a little, who mistimes the drive to mid-off

Just cannot understand this strategy of not using Umran Malik upfront when he can dent the opposition with a couple of quick wickets like Mark Wood. The same conservative tendencies have been costing India at ICC events as well.
Umran Malik to Jaiswal, 1 run, back of a length angling into the hips, Jaiswal nudges wide of mid-wicket for a quick single
Umran Malik to Samson, , good short ball at Samson who just pulled and got a fat top-edge that sails away over Glenn Phillips, all the way too
Umran Malik to Samson, 1 run, hard good length on the stumps, Samson makes room slightly and dabs that wide of backward point
Umran Malik to Jaiswal, no run, pacy back of a length delivery outside off, Jaiswal slashes and misses
Adil Rashid to Samson, , dragged down and Samson doesn't miss out. Rocks back and pulls to the crowd at deep mid-wicket
Adil Rashid to Samson, 1 run, tossed up full on off, Samson drives to long-on
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, 1 run, tossed up full on the middle and leg line, Jaiswal gets forward to flick to deep mid-wicket
Adil Rashid to Samson, 1 run, slower legbreak outside off, Samson dabs it wide of short third man
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, no run, good ball, the legbreak and pitches outside off, extra bounce and slides past the poke of Jaiswal
Adil Rashid to Jaiswal, 1 run, tossed up legbreak on middle-stump, Jaiswal gets forward to flick to deep mid-wicket

Adil Rashid might be a pick of the day as he slows down the pace of innings while he may not pick many wickets like Rashid Khan.But he and Umran through the middle overs might bring SRH back into game after that big start from RR.
Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, 1 run, flat good length on the stumps, Jaiswal nudges to long-on and once again Samson does not want the 2nd
Washington Sundar to Samson, 1 run, not short to pull, Samson still muscles the pull to long-on on the bounce
Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, no run, back of a length outside off, Jaiswal punches and extra-cover gets across and cuts it off with a dive
Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, no run, nicely bowled, slowed it up and got turn away, Jaiswal tries to turn to leg and misses as he plays too early
Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, 1 run,  Quicker length delivery on the stumps, tucked through mid-wicket which is open
Washington Sundar to Jaiswal, 1 run,  Quicker length delivery on the stumps, tucked through mid-wicket which is open
Washington Sundar to Samson, no run, back of a length outside off, Samson cuts to backward point
paras Umran has just raw pace whereas Mark Wood has both control and pace

Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, , fantastic from Jaiswal. Fazalhaq Farooqi did well to follow him outside the leg-stump with a full delivery, Jaiswal drills that with lots of bottom-hand and gets it wide of mid-off
It has not carried
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal, no run, length delivery outside off, Jaiswal swipes and the thick under-edge is found, . Credit to Phillips who wanted it to go upstairs for he was not sure
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal,  Caught!!

Fazalhaq Farooqi to Jaiswal,  Caught by Mayank at deep mid-wicket!! Fazalhaq Farooqi gets his 2nd. Dug in short and Jaiswal totally miscued the pull, toe-ends it and finds deep mid-wicket. End of a good knock but now he has to go.
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Padikkal, leg byes, 1 run, back of a length angling into the thigh pad, Padikkal flicks and misses, off the thigh pad for a legbye
Fazalhaq Farooqi round the wicket
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Samson, 1 run, the attempted yorker is a low full-toss outside off, Samson opens the face of the bat and drives wide of backward point to his left
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Padikkal, no run, superb inswinging yorker on the stumps, Padikkal does well to dig it out

Washington Sundar to Samson, , what a blow. This is a length offbreak that turns in, Samson goes on the back foot and makes it shorter than what it really is, generates great power to flat-bat it way over long-off. Exceptional hit
Washington Sundar to Samson, 1 run, tries to repeat the previous shot, but Washington Sundar has got more oomph on this offbreak, Samson can only find long-on
Washington Sundar wants a change of field, has a word with Bhuvi.
Washington Sundar to Padikkal, 1 run, a slip in for Padikkal, tossed up full on the stumps, Padikkal gets forward to drive to long-off
Washington Sundar to Samson, no run, offbreak turns into off-stump, Samson makes room to cut to backward point
How SRH react to the initial onslaught determines if they are chasing a total of around 200 or  something over 225. They just need to hang on.
Washington Sundar to Samson, 1 run, flat offbreak on a back of a length outside off, Samson punches to sweeper cover who gets across and cuts it off
Washington Sundar to Padikkal, 1 run, very full on the stumps, driven past the diving cover
Washington Sundar to Padikkal, 1 run, very full on the stumps, driven past the diving cover
Umran Malik to Padikkal,  Bowled!!

Umran Malik to Padikkal,  Bowled!! Umran Malik cleans up Padikkal and instead of his trademark punch the air celebration, he stops midway and smiles at Padikkal with a big dimple dotting the pacer's face. Lovely. No feet from Padikkal as it stays low from a good length and skids from there, uproots off-stump after beating the defence. SRH fighting back.

Umran Malik to Riyan Parag, , my word! Short and wide outside off, Riyan Parag does not hold back, smashes the cut and it's nearly all the way over deep cover, one bounce over the ropes. That is some shot

Umran Malik to Riyan Parag, byes, 1 run, back of a length and nips back in from outside off, Riyan Parag pulls and misses, Glenn Phillips dives to his left but can only parry it to fine-leg where Farooqi does well to prevent the four
Umran Malik to Samson, , slips it down leg, past the glance

The only positive for SRH at the moment is that their Captain Markram has scored a Century against Netherlands, which indicates that he is in great touch and would represent SRH with a great momentum!!
Umran Malik to Samson, 1 run, short and wide outside off, Samson reaches for it and cuts it to third man for a single
Umran Malik to Riyan Parag, 1 run, goes full on the stumps, Riyan Parag drives to long-on and turns the strike over
Umran Malik to Samson, 1 run, full and sliding into the pads, flicked to deep backward square leg for one
Adil Rashid to Samson, , that's too much flight, tossed up full outside off, in the slot, Samson lofts clean and nice over long-off
Adil Rashid to Samson, 1 run, goes wide of the crease and bowls it wider outside off, Samson reaches for it and drives to sweeper cover
Adil Rashid to Riyan Parag, 1 run, slower legbreak on the stumps, gently nudged for one to long-on
Adil Rashid to Samson, no run,  A thick inside-edge as Samson gets forward to loft and yes it did carry to Farooqi who dived to his right but can't hang on
Adil Rashid to Samson, 1 run, the front of the hand slider outside off, dabbed to short third man
Adil Rashid to Riyan Parag, 1 run, slower on a good length on the stumps, Riyan Parag turns it to the vacant square leg area
! RR may have slowed down after the powerplay but still look good to get over 200 here.
! RR may have slowed down after the powerplay but still look good to get over 200 here.
T Natarajan to Riyan Parag,  Caught!!

T Natarajan to Riyan Parag,  Caught by Fazalhaq Farooqi!! The timeout takes a wicket. How often does that happen. A length delivery, the slower off-cutter across Riyan Parag who gets forward to heave and a thick outside-edge goes straight up, Farooqi at short third man goes back and hangs on this time.
T Natarajan to Hetmyer, 1 run, full delivery on the pads, flicked away to deep square leg

Mustafa Moudi, not the oly positive brother, i am really looking forward for their batting.
given, the young power hitters SRH have.
T Natarajan to Samson, 1 run,  Another slower ball off-cutter outside off, driven wide of extra-cover
T Natarajan to Hetmyer, no run, slower ball off-cutter on off, pushed back and T Natarajan dives to his left to stop it
T Natarajan to Hetmyer, 1 run, the attempted yorker on the stumps, is a low full-toss, clipped to deep mid-wicket
T Natarajan to Samson, no run, Samson missed out there, slices the low full-toss across him to backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, 1 run, back of a length outside off, cut to sweeper cover
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, 1 run, good yorker outside the leg-stump as Bhuvneshwar follows Samson backing away, dug out to extra-cover
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, ,  A slower ball short ball dug in, Hetmyer waits and thumps it way back over deep square leg, sports a smile after hitting that
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, no run, good yorker just inside the tramline on the off-side, Hetmyer lets it go and it's inside the line
Bhuvneshwar to Hetmyer, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Hetmyer goes low on one knee to drive that hard and straight to long-off
Bhuvneshwar to Samson, , misses the yorker, was full on the pads, flicked away wide of short fine-leg inside the ring, Samson ends the over well
T Natarajan to Hetmyer, no run,  Good yorker on the stumps, dug out to cover, Hetmyer was halfway down when he was sent back, he gave up, but Bhuvi's lob misses and Hetmyer survives
T Natarajan to Hetmyer, no run,  Good yorker on the stumps, dug out to cover, Hetmyer was halfway down when he was sent back, he gave up, but Bhuvi's lob misses and Hetmyer survives
T Natarajan to Hetmyer, 1 run, low full-toss on off, Hetmyer thrashes it straight to the fielder at long-off
T Natarajan to Samson,  Caught!!

T Natarajan to Samson,  Caught by Abhishek Sharma!! Superb balancing act with the left-foot from Abhishek at deep mid-wicket and he sends Samson back. A back of a length delivery outside off, Samson swiped and nearly got it all the way, Abhishek was there on the edge of the cushions, takes it and then juggles his left-foot beautifully to not touch the skirting.
RR must move on from Riyan Parag. They have given him enough chances. He has been disappointing in most matches

T Natarajan to Ashwin, byes, , sloppy from Glenn Phillips, T Natarajan beats Ashwin with a slower ball across him, Phillips does not get the body behind as he dives forward, gives away four needless runs
T Natarajan to Ashwin, 1 run, low full-toss on off, Ashwin drives to backward point and a poor throw from Washington way over the stumps at the bowler's end, but long-on is there quickly to mop up
T Natarajan to Hetmyer, 1 run, low full-toss swinging in to the pads, flicked away to deep backward square leg
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hetmyer, 2 runs, full outside off, Hetmyer drags the heave to deep mid-wicket and they come back for a quick two
Clear bump ball.

Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hetmyer, no run, good yorker outside off, Hetmyer toe-ends the run-down and it has bounced through to Glenn Phillips, they think it's a catch but replays show clearly it has bounced
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hetmyer, no run, fantastic yorker outside off, Hetmyer can only dig it back to Fazalhaq Farooqi. Two precious dots

Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hetmyer, 2 runs,  Comical scenes everywhere. A very full delivery outside off, carved to Mayank at sweeper cover, Ashwin does not want the 2nd, but Hetmyer does, they almost run into each other, but avoid, there is a clear run-out chance at Fazalhaq Farooqi's end, but the bowler fumbles the throw to draw a puzzled reaction from Mayank. Ashwin was well out had Farooqi collected and broken the stumps. Amidst all this, they check for a short run too, but Hetmyer has plonked his bat over the line. Phew!
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hetmyer, , Fazalhaq Farooqi misses the yorker outside off, half-volley outside off, slammed straight down the ground, Hetmyer stayed back and pumped that
Fazalhaq Farooqi to Hetmyer, 2 runs, very full outside off, almost yorker length, Hetmyer digs it out to deep mid-wicket and comes back for two even as the throw comes to his end, RR end on 203

Massive score by RR. They were set on their way with a belligerent powerplay from Buttler and Jaiswal. Both batters tore into the SRH attack and the result was a 20-ball fifty for Buttler. Just when it looked like Buttler would go on to break records, he was undone by a good ball from Fazalhaq Farooqi. Jaiswal slowed down after that and Samson at three took over the aggressor's role. Jaiswal got out after his fifty and SRH fought back with wickets but Samson was there and he reached his fifty to continue his good run in the IPL in his side's opening games of the season. At the end, SRH bowled well and kept it down to 203 with good death bowling from Natarajan and Farooqi. Still 203 will take some chasing even though the wicket is good and the outfield is fast. Advantage RR at the moment. Back for the chase shortly...

(On the surface) Some grip, some go straight on. Very good batting pitch and they played exceptionally. Didn’t allow our bowlers to settle. The bowlers did exceptionally well to restrict them to 203 from the position they were in, the last 6 overs were great. Feels incredible to play in front of a full side, hopefully many more to come. After seeing the pitch, maybe this target is 5-10 more than par but we’ll take that with our batting line-up. Hopefully I won’t be asked to bat, and if at all just a few runs late on to knock it around.
Welcome back. Still no Impact players for both sides. Boult with two slips.
Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run, short of length on off, shapes away a hint, Abhishek Sharma with a neat back foot block
Boult to Abhishek Sharma, no run, Abhishek Sharma wanted to go at Boult there, short of length on the stumps, cramps Sharma who pushes to mid-on
Boult to Abhishek Sharma,  Bowled!!

Boult to Abhishek Sharma,  Bowled!! What an outswinging yorker. Peach. Boult at his best. Abhishek Sharma helped him by staying leg-side of the ball as he tried to dig it out, the ball swings away and knocks back off-stump. Perfect start for RR.
Boult to Tripathi, no run, short of length on off, nearly squares up Tripathi who stumbles a tad but defends it back
Boult to Tripathi,  Caught!!

Boult to Tripathi,  Caught by Holder!!  Tripathi is going nowhere. He thinks it is a bump-ball. Surprisingly Tripathi reviews and umpire KN Anantha Padmanabhan is having a word with the batter. Is this an umpire's review or a batter's review? It is the batter's. Outstanding catch by the tall Holder, stretching his left-hand and grabbing it at a wide slip. Tripathi came down the track and opened the face on this full outswinger outside off, guided it wide of Holder but the big man just plucked it from thin air.  SRH lose their review too.

Boult to Tripathi,  Caught by Holder!!  Tripathi is going nowhere. He thinks it is a bump-ball. Surprisingly Tripathi reviews and umpire KN Anantha Padmanabhan is having a word with the batter. Is this an umpire's review or a batter's review? It is the batter's. Outstanding catch by the tall Holder, stretching his left-hand and grabbing it at a wide slip. Tripathi came down the track and opened the face on this full outswinger outside off, guided it wide of Holder but the big man just plucked it from thin air.  SRH lose their review too.

Boult to Harry Brook, no run,  What an over this is. This full inswinger slips down leg, did it catch the pad of Harry Brook who flicks and misses? umpire KN Anantha Padmanabhan certainly thinks so, now Samson dives to his left to save four certain runs

The slip has gone to short fine-leg
KM Asif to Harry Brook, no run, short of length outside off, Harry Brook punches to backward point

No one wants to play an anchor role except few players like Rahul and Dhawan. Every player wants to go for 4s and 6s. They don’t understand the meaning of “Getting set and go for the shots”. T20 also needs a matured way of batting, no player understands it.

The replay shows that Washington Sundar would have been home even if that hit

IPL cricket returned to Hyderabad after four years, the stadium was filled with orange but the colour began to fade as the game started, with a few pink and purple hues emerging. A case of Murphy's law for Sunrisers, who were given a drubbing by the Rajasthan openers as they conceded their highest powerplay tally. Samson got a fifty as well, as RR finished with a solid first innings score. In reply, SRH were given a 'Boult from the pink' as their in-form batters Rahul Tripathi and Abhishek Sharma fell for ducks. Harry Brook had a forgettable IPL debut as well, as the spinners began their stranglehold. Mayank Agarwal showed some promise but perished against Chahal, and the rest of the middle-order failed to contribute much. It took a few late tonks from the impact player Abdul Samad and Umran Malik to get SRH to a respectable total, while even crossing 100 looked a challenge at one point.

A case of Murphy's law for Sunrisers, who were given a drubbing by the Rajasthan openers as they conceded their highest powerplay tally. Samson got a fifty as well, as RR finished with a solid first innings score. In reply, SRH were given a 'Boult from the pink' as their in-form batters Rahul Tripathi and Abhishek Sharma fell for ducks. Harry Brook had a forgettable IPL debut as well, as the spinners began their stranglehold. Mayank Agarwal showed some promise but perished against Chahal, and the rest of the middle-order failed to contribute much. It took a few late tonks from the impact player Abdul Samad and Umran Malik to get SRH to a respectable total, while even crossing 100 looked a challenge at one point.

For Rajasthan, as perfect a game as they could have had. Their openers got runs as Buttler and Jaiswal started off from where they left last season. Samson got his customary good start to the IPL. Trent Boult picked powerplay wickets, Yuzi Chahal got a four-fer and Ravi Ashwin bowled economically. Their debutant Jason Holder had a good game with the bowl and in the field, and wasn’t needed to bat. They even got their rookie bowler KM Asif to bowl out without much pressure, and got a returning Navdeep Saini to get some game practice. Onto the presentations now...

Their debutant Jason Holder had a good game with the bowl and in the field, and wasn’t needed to bat. They even got their rookie bowler KM Asif to bowl out without much pressure, and got a returning Navdeep Saini to get some game practice. Onto the presentations now...

100 per cent we can say that, let's forget and move on, the way we pulled back in the last 6 overs and Umran's cameo at the end. We did not bowl pretty well, first match of the season and a lot to improve. South Africans are coming back and we definitely will be a much better batting side, we have to move forward from this game. It was a pretty good track, we can prepare what we want but we are not worried about that.

100 per cent we can say that, let's forget and move on, the way we pulled back in the last 6 overs and Umran's cameo at the end. We did not bowl pretty well, first match of the season and a lot to improve. South Africans are coming back and we definitely will be a much better batting side, we have to move forward from this game. It was a pretty good track, we can prepare what we want but we are not worried about that.

Definitely the start we wanted. The way Jos and Jaiswal batted, we knew a big score will always be difficult to score. The plan was to bowl stump to stump, tossing it up is my strength. I’m not too bothered about who I’m bowling to. Definitely you’ll see a big celebration when I get a five wicket haul.

Definitely the start we wanted. The way Jos and Jaiswal batted, we knew a big score will always be difficult to score. The plan was to bowl stump to stump, tossing it up is my strength. I’m not too bothered about who I’m bowling to. Definitely you’ll see a big celebration when I get a five wicket haul.

Was wondering how we'll start this season, very happy with this. Having batters like Buttler and Jaiswal, the mindset with which they play the powerplay we can expect such starts. We are a very good side, but you know this format. So we need to keep our heads down. Today was a very good start but we are looking at finishing things well. For me, today I wanted to stay there and finish the innings. We will find out if there are any weaknesses as the tournament goes on (chuckles).

We are a very good side, but you know this format. So we need to keep our heads down. Today was a very good start but we are looking at finishing things well. For me, today I wanted to stay there and finish the innings. We will find out if there are any weaknesses as the tournament goes on (chuckles).

Fantastic start. We had a really good last season but this is a great marker for this time, we start fresh. I plan a bit but react on the day, assess the conditions and try and put pressure on the bowlers. Enjoying my cricket at the moment, playing with a clear mind.

That's all from Hyderabad. Once again a sense of deja vu as Rajasthan thump SRH with last season's heroes Buttler, Samson, Chahal, Boult all performing. A reality check for this SRH side which was looking really good on paper. Well, the good news is their South African trio will arrive soon. For now, time to switch tabs to the MI game where Reece Topley has just castled Cam Green. See you there...
